conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
The two cars are side by side at \\( t = 30 \\) seconds.
The v-t graph shows Car A traveling at a constant velocity of 40 m/s from \\( t = 0 \\) to \\( t = 10 \\) seconds.
The v-t graph shows Car B starting from rest and accelerating uniformly.
Car B reaches a velocity of 40 m/s at \\( t = 10 \\) seconds.
The area under the graph represents the distance traveled by each car.
The distance traveled by Car A up to \\( t = 10 \\) seconds is 400 meters.
The distance traveled by Car B up to \\( t = 10 \\) seconds is 200 meters.
At \\( t = 10 \\) seconds, Car A has traveled 400 meters and Car B has traveled 200 meters.
Car A is ahead of Car B at \\( t = 10 \\) seconds.
